title: FT:  T206 HOF'ers, centered in midgrade
author: ZiggerZagger

posts.post_title: FT:  T206 HOF'ers, centered in midgrade

posts.post_content: Looks & sounds like you have a great collection Jason.  Good luck getting across the finish line.  Do you have your set listed in Scot Reader's T206 Insider Registry?

[quote name="Bobbycee" post=1981452]Looks & sounds like you have a great collection Jason.  Good luck getting across the finish line.  Do you have your set listed in Scot Reader's T206 Insider Registry?[/QUOTE]

Scot's work and website are amazing, although my set is not listed on there presently.
He has very kindly 'contributed' a handful of tough cards to my own set, though, and he has been such a pleasure getting to know!

My PSA cards are listed on the PSA Registry T206 set of 520 under my screen name here, with all photos uploaded.  Feel free to check it out!
|

posts.post_title: Wish I had the ones you need
posts.post_content:
[quote name="ZiggerZagger" post=1981547]Some requests via PM/email for scans of the Red Cobb/Young Portrait/WaJo Pitching cards.

Again, any of these 3 would probably only be moved in trade + cash deal to acquire a PSA 4-5 copy of the Young (Portrait) or Cobb (Red/Bat On/Bat Off).  Thanks!

[URL=http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=400360&d=]Attachment 400360[/URL][URL=http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=400362&d=]Attachment 400362[/URL][URL=http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=400363&d=]Attachment 400363[/URL][/QUOTE]

The ones you are trading are stunning!
